thread.title: Car airbags disabled by hackers as cyber-crooks target the safety features in your motor
thread.title_full: Car airbags disabled by hackers as cyber-crooks target the safety features in your motor - Mirror Online

author: Jeff Parsons
title: Car airbags disabled by hackers as cyber-crooks target the safety features in your motor
text:
Cars are becoming ever-more computerised and a worrying new security flaw has been exposed by a team of security experts.
Hackers are able to disable a car's airbags - as well as other functions - by exploiting the software used by mechanics during servicing.
Regardless of how advanced the car is , these digital deviants could break in without the mechanic's knowledge and switch off the car's computer-controlled airbag system.
"Anything that can be switched on or off from the diagnostic application could have been switched on or off," said Levente Buttyan from CrySyS Lab - the experts who demonstrated the hack .
"After switching off the airbag, we can consistently report to the application that it is still switched on."
The team at CrySyS Lab, working with Budapest University, demonstrated the hack on an Audi, but they said any car brand was potentially hackable.
That's because many mechanics use similar types of software to run diagnostics.
